question: Which country's UNESCO World Heritage Site is the "Routes of Santiago de Compostela"?
explanation: The Routes of Santiago de Compostela is the UNESCO World Heritage Site of France. Santiago de Compostela was the supreme goal for countless thousands of pious pilgrims who converged there from all over Europe throughout the Middle Ages. To reach Spain pilgrims had to pass through France, and the group of important historical monuments included in this inscription marks out the four routes by which they did so.
